caption.title: Quantification of GAS in the lungs, blood, and spleens of mice treated with antisera 2 h after superinfection.
caption.p: Mice were infected i.n. with 0.1 LD 50 IAV on day 0 and GAS on day 7 followed 2 h later by treatment with antisera to the M protein, SLO, or non-immune sera as a control (ctrl). Mice were euthanized 24 h later and the number of GAS present in blood, lungs, and spleens was determined by dilution plating. Differences between the individual groups were not statistically significant ( p > 0.05); however, there were fewer GAS in the lungs and spleen of mice treated with either antisera to SLO or the M protein compared to those treated with non-immune sera ( p < 0.05; *). Statistical significance was determined with the Student's t-test.
